summary.span: Converts a base data type to another base data type.

span.span: Converts a base data type to another base data type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类的静态方法主要用于支持与 .NET Framework 中的基本数据类型之间的转换。The static methods of the class are primarily used to support conversion to and from the base data types in the .NET Framework. 支持的基类型为 、、、、、、、、、、、、、 和 。The supported base types are , , , , , , , , , , , , , and . 此外， 类包括支持其他类型的转换的方法。In addition, the class includes methods to support other kinds of conversions. 本主题包括以下各节：This topic consists of the following sections: 与[基类型之间的转换](#Base) [Conversions to and from Base Types](#Base) [非十进制数字](#NonDecimal) [Non-Decimal Numbers](#NonDecimal) [从自定义对象到基类型的转换](#Custom) [Conversions from Custom Objects to Base Types](#Custom) [区域性特定的格式设置信息](#Culture) [Culture-Specific Formatting Information](#Culture) [Base64 编码](#Base64) [Base64 Encoding](#Base64) [其他常见转换Other Common Conversions](#Other) ## 与基类型之间的转换Conversions to and from Base Types 存在将每个基类型转换为每个其他基类型的转换方法。A conversion method exists to convert every base type to every other base type. 但是，对特定转换方法的实际调用会生成五个结果中的一个，具体取决于运行时基类型的值和目标基类型。However, the actual call to a particular conversion method can produce one of five outcomes, depending on the value of the base type at run time and the target base type. 这五个结果为：These five outcomes are: - 无转换。No conversion. 当尝试从某一类型转换为自身（例如，通过使用 类型的自变量调用 ）时，会发生这种情况。This occurs when an attempt is made to convert from a type to itself (for example, by calling with an argument of type ). 在这种情况下，方法只返回原始类型的实例。In this case, the method simply returns an instance of the original type. - 一个 。An . 当不支持特定转换时，会发生这种情况。This occurs when a particular conversion is not supported. 为以下转换引发 ：An is thrown for the following conversions: - 从 到 、、、或 的转换。Conversions from to , , , , or . - 从 、、、或 到 的转换。Conversions from , , , , or to . - 从 到除 以外的其他任何类型的转换。Conversions from to any other type except . - 从除 以外的其他任何类型转换为 。Conversions from any other type, except , to . - 。A . 当尝试将字符串值转换为其他任何基类型时，如果该字符串的格式不正确，则会发生这种情况。This occurs when the attempt to convert a string value to any other base type fails because the string is not in the proper format. 对于以下转换，将引发异常：The exception is thrown for the following conversions: - 要转换为 值的字符串不等于 或 。A string to be converted to a value does not equal or . - 要转换为 值的字符串由多个字符组成。A string to be converted to a value consists of multiple characters. - 要转换为任意数值类型的字符串未被识别为有效数字。A string to be converted to any numeric type is not recognized as a valid number. - 要转换为 的字符串未被识别为有效的日期和时间值。A string to be converted to a is not recognized as a valid date and time value. - 成功的转换。A successful conversion. 对于前面的结果中未列出的两个不同的基类型之间的转换，所有扩大转换以及不会导致数据丢失的所有收缩转换都将成功，并且方法将返回目标基类型的值。For conversions between two different base types not listed in the previous outcomes, all widening conversions as well as all narrowing conversions that do not result in a loss of data will succeed and the method will return a value of the targeted base type. - 一个 。An . 当收缩转换导致数据丢失时，会发生这种情况。This occurs when a narrowing conversion results in a loss of data. 例如，尝试将值为10000的 实例转换为 类型会引发 ，因为10000超出 数据类型的范围。For example, trying to convert a instance whose value is 10000 to a type throws an because 10000 is outside the range of the data type. 如果转换数值类型会导致精度损失（即，丢失一些最小有效位），则不会引发异常。An exception will not be thrown if the conversion of a numeric type results in a loss of precision (that is, the loss of some least significant digits). 但是，如果结果大于可用特定转换方法的返回值类型表示的结果，则会引发异常。However, an exception will be thrown if the result is larger than can be represented by the particular conversion method's return value type. 例如，将 转换为 时，可能会发生精度损失，但不会引发异常。For example, when a is converted to a , a loss of precision might occur but no exception is thrown. 但是，如果 太大而无法由 表示，则会引发溢出异常。However, if the magnitude of the is too large to be represented by a , an overflow exception is thrown. ## 非十进制数字Non-Decimal Numbers 类包含静态方法，您可以调用这些方法将整数值转换为非十进制字符串表示形式，并将表示非十进制数字的字符串转换为整数值。The class includes static methods that you can call to convert integral values to non-decimal string representations, and to convert strings that represent non-decimal numbers to integral values. 这些转换方法中的每一种都包含一个 `base` 参数，使用该参数可以指定数字系统;binary （基数为2）、八进制（基数为8）和十六进制（以16为基数）以及十进制（以10为底）。Each of these conversion methods includes a `base` argument that lets you specify the number system; binary (base 2), octal (base 8), and hexadecimal (base 16), as well as decimal (base 10). 有一组方法可以将符合 CLS 的每个基元整型类型转换为一个字符串，还可以将一个字符串转换为每个基元整型类型：There is a set of methods to convert each of the CLS-compliant primitive integral types to a string, and one to convert a string to each of the primitive integral types: - 和 ，将字节值与指定基数的字符串相互转换。 and , to convert a byte value to and from a string in a specified base. - 和 ，将16位带符号整数与指定基中的字符串相互转换。 and , to convert a 16-bit signed integer to and from a string in a specified base. - 和 ，以将32位有符号整数与指定基数的字符串相互转换。 and , to convert a 32-bit signed integer to and from a string in a specified base. - 和 ，以将64位有符号整数与指定基数的字符串相互转换。 and , to convert a 64-bit signed integer to and from a string in a specified base. - ，用于将指定格式的字节值的字符串表示形式转换为有符号字节。, to convert the string representation of a byte value in a specified format to a signed byte. - ，用于将指定格式的整数的字符串表示形式转换为16位无符号整数。, to convert the string representation of an integer in a specified format to an unsigned 16-bit integer. - ，用于将指定格式的整数的字符串表示形式转换为无符号32位整数。, to convert the string representation of an integer in a specified format to an unsigned 32-bit integer. - ，用于将指定格式的整数的字符串表示形式转换为无符号64位整数。, to convert the string representation of an integer in a specified format to an unsigned 64-bit integer. 下面的示例将 的值转换为支持的所有数字格式的字符串。The following example converts the value of to a string in all supported numeric formats. 然后，它将字符串值转换回 值。It then converts the string value back to a value. [!code-cpp[System.Convert#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert/CPP/NonDecimal1.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Convert#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert/CS/NonDecimal1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Convert#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert/VB/NonDecimal1.vb#2)] ## 从自定义对象到基类型的转换Conversions from Custom Objects to Base Types 除了支持基类型之间的转换以外， 方法还支持将任何自定义类型转换为任何基类型。In addition to supporting conversions between the base types, the method supports conversion of any custom type to any base type. 为此，自定义类型必须实现 接口，该接口定义将实现类型转换为每个基类型的方法。To do this, the custom type must implement the interface, which defines methods for converting the implementing type to each of the base types. 特定类型不支持的转换应引发 。Conversions that are not supported by a particular type should throw an . 当向 方法传递自定义类型作为其第一个参数，或调用 `Convert.To`*类型*方法（如 或 ，并将自定义类型的实例作为其第一个参数传递时，， 方法又会调用自定义类型的 实现来执行转换。When the method is passed a custom type as its first parameter, or when the `Convert.To`*Type* method (such as or is called and passed an instance of a custom type as its first parameter, the method, in turn, calls the custom type's implementation to perform the conversion. 有关详细信息，请参阅[.NET Framework 中的类型转换](~/docs/standard/base-types/type-conversion.md)。For more information, see [Type Conversion in the .NET Framework](~/docs/standard/base-types/type-conversion.md). ## 区域性特定的格式设置信息Culture-Specific Formatting Information 所有基类型转换方法和 方法都包含具有 类型的参数的重载。All the base type conversion methods and the method include overloads that have a parameter of type . 例如， 方法具有以下两个重载：For example, the method has the following two overloads: - - 参数可以提供区域性特定的格式设置信息来帮助转换过程。The parameter can supply culture-specific formatting information to assist the conversion process. 但是，它将被大多数基类型转换方法忽略。However, it is ignored by most of the base type conversion methods. 它仅用于以下基类型转换方法。如果 `null` 参数传递给这些方法，则使用表示当前线程区域性的 对象。It is used only by the following base type conversion methods.If a `null` argument is passed to these methods, the object that represents the current thread culture is used. - 通过将值转换为数值类型的方法。By methods that convert a value to a numeric type. 参数由具有 和 类型参数的重载使用。The parameter is used by the overload that has parameters of type and . 如果该对象的运行时类型是 ，则它还由具有 类型的参数的重载使用，。It is also used by the overload that has parameters of type and if the object's run-time type is a . - 通过将值转换为日期和时间的方法。By methods that convert a value to a date and time. 参数由具有 和 类型参数的重载使用。The parameter is used by the overload that has parameters of type and . 如果该对象的运行时类型是 ，则它还由具有 类型的参数的重载使用，。It is also used by the overload that has parameters of type and if the object's run-time type is a . - 通过 重载，其中包含一个 参数，并将数值转换为字符串或将 值转换为字符串。By the overloads that include an parameter and that convert either a numeric value to a string or a value to a string. 但是，任何实现 的用户定义类型都可以使用 参数。However, any user-defined type that implements can make use of the parameter. ## Base64 编码Base64 Encoding Base64 编码将二进制数据转换为字符串。Base64 encoding converts binary data to a string. 可以轻松地通过只能传输7位字符的数据通道来传达以64位数字表示的数据。Data expressed as base-64 digits can be easily conveyed over data channels that can only transmit 7-bit characters. 类包括以下支持 base64 编码的方法：一组方法支持将字节数组转换为 ，或从一组 Unicode 字符转换为一组 Unicode 字符，其中包含64位字符。The class includes the following methods to support base64 encoding: A set of methods support converting an array of bytes to and from a or to and from an array of Unicode characters consisting of base-64 digit characters. - ，它将字节数组转换为 base64 编码的字符串。, which converts a byte array to a base64-encoded string. - ，它将字节数组转换为 base64 编码的字符数组。, which converts a byte array to a base64-encoded character array. - ，它将 base64 编码的字符串转换为字节数组。, which converts a base64-encoded string to a byte array. - ，它将 base64 编码的字符数组转换为字节数组。, which converts a base64-encoded character array to a byte array. ## 其他常见转换Other Common Conversions 您可以使用 NET Framework 中的其他类来执行某些不受 类的静态方法支持的转换。You can use other classes in the NET Framework to perform some conversions that are not supported by the static methods of the class. 其中包括:These include: 转换为字节数组Conversion to byte arrays 类提供一些方法，这些方法可将基元数值类型（包括 ）转换为字节数组，并将字节数组转换回基元数据类型。The class provides methods that convert the primitive numeric types (including ) to byte arrays and from byte arrays back to primitive data types. 字符编码和解码Character encoding and decoding 类及其派生类（如 和 ）提供了编码字符数组或字符串的方法（即，将它们转换为特定编码的字节数组），并对编码的字节数组进行解码（即，将字节数组转换回 UTF16 编码的 Unicode 字符。The class and its derived classes (such as and ) provide methods to encode a character array or a string (that is, to convert them to a byte array in a particular encoding) and to decode an encoded byte array (that is, convert a byte array back to UTF16-encoded Unicode characters. 有关详细信息，请参阅[中的字符编码 .NET Framework](~/docs/standard/base-types/character-encoding.md)For more information, see [Character Encoding in the .NET Framework](~/docs/standard/base-types/character-encoding.md) ## Examples 下面的示例演示了 类中的一些转换方法，包括 、和 。The following example demonstrates some of the conversion methods in the class, including , , and . [!code-cpp[System.Convert#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert/CPP/converter.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Convert#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert/CS/converter.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Convert#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert/VB/converter.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是一种通用转换方法，它将 `value` 指定的对象转换为 `conversionType`。 is a general-purpose conversion method that converts the object specified by `value` to `conversionType`. `value` 参数可以是任何类型的对象，`conversionType` 也可以是表示任何基或自定义类型的 对象。The `value` parameter can be an object of any type, and `conversionType` can also be a object that represents any base or custom type. 若要成功进行转换，`value` 必须实现 接口，因为方法只是包装对适当 方法的调用。For the conversion to succeed, `value` must implement the interface, because the method simply wraps a call to an appropriate method. 方法要求将 `value` 转换为 `conversionType`。The method requires that conversion of `value` to `conversionType` be supported. 此方法使用当前线程的区域性进行转换。This method uses the current thread's culture for the conversion. ## Examples 下面的示例演示 方法的用法。The following example illustrates the use of the method. [!code-cpp[convertchangetype#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/convertchangetype/CPP/convertchangetype.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[convertchangetype#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/convertchangetype/CS/convertchangetype.cs#1)] [!code-vb[convertchangetype#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/convertchangetype/VB/convertchangetype.vb#1)]

para.span: 但是，它不能将另一种类型转换为枚举值，即使源类型是枚举的基础类型。

span.span: However, it cannot convert another type to an enumeration value, even if the source type is the underlying type of the enumeration.

para.span: 若要将某一类型转换为枚举值，请使用强制转换C#运算符（在中）或转换函数（在 Visual Basic 中）。

span.span: However, it cannot convert another type to a value of a nullable type, even if is the underlying type of the .To perform the conversion, you can use a casting operator (in C#) or a conversion function (in Visual Basic).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是一种通用转换方法，它将 `value` 指定的对象转换为 `typeCode`指定的预定义类型。 is a general-purpose conversion method that converts the object specified by `value` to a predefined type specified by `typeCode`. `value` 参数可以是任何类型的对象。The `value` parameter can be an object of any type. 若要成功进行转换，`value` 必须实现 接口，因为方法只是包装对适当 方法的调用。For the conversion to succeed, `value` must implement the interface, because the method simply wraps a call to an appropriate method. 方法还要求 `value` 转换为 `typeCode`。The method also requires that conversion of `value` to `typeCode` be supported. 方法不支持将 `value` 转换为自定义类型。The method does not support the conversion of `value` to a custom type. 若要执行此类转换，请调用 方法。To perform such a conversion, call the method. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用 方法将 更改为 参数指定的类型（如果可能）。The following example illustrates how to use the method to change an to the type specified by the parameter, if possible. [!code-cpp[System.Convert.ChangeType#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cpp/changetype_01.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ChangeType#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/cs/changetype01.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ChangeType#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.changetype/vb/changetype01.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是一种通用转换方法，它将 `value` 指定的对象转换为 `conversionType`。 is a general-purpose conversion method that converts the object specified by `value` to `conversionType`. `value` 参数可以是任何类型的对象，`conversionType` 也可以是表示任何基或自定义类型的 对象。The `value` parameter can be an object of any type, and `conversionType` can also be a object that represents any base or custom type. 若要成功进行转换，`value` 必须实现 接口，因为方法只是包装对适当 方法的调用。For the conversion to succeed, `value` must implement the interface, because the method simply wraps a call to an appropriate method. 方法要求将 `value` 转换为 `conversionType`。The method requires that conversion of `value` to `conversionType` be supported. `provider` 参数是为转换提供格式设置信息的 实现。The `provider` parameter is an implementation that supplies formatting information for the conversion. 是否以及如何使用此参数取决于基础 实现。Whether and how this parameter is used depends on the underlying implementation. 如果 `value` 是基本数据类型，则 `provider` 仅用于以下转换：If `value` is a base data type, `provider` is used only for the following conversions: - 从数字转换为字符串，或将字符串转换为数字。Conversion from a number to a string, or from a string to a number. `provider` 必须是 对象、 对象或返回 对象的自定义 实现。`provider` must be a object, a object, or a custom implementation that returns a object. 但是，由于 方法使用默认的 "G" 格式说明符执行转换，因此，如果 `value` 或目标类型为无符号整数，则 `provider` 参数不起作用。However, because the method performs the conversion using the default "G" format specifier, the `provider` parameter has no effect if `value` or the target type is an unsigned integer. 如果 `null``provider`，则使用表示当前线程区域性的 对象。If `provider` is `null`, the object that represents the current thread culture is used. - 从 值转换为字符串，或从字符串转换为 值。Conversion from a value to a string, or from a string to a value. `provider` 必须是 或 对象。`provider` must be a or object. 如果 `null``provider`，则使用表示当前线程区域性的 对象。If `provider` is `null`, the object that represents the current thread culture is used. 如果 `value` 是应用程序定义的类型，则其 实现可以使用 `provider` 参数。If `value` is an application-defined type, its implementation may use the `provider` parameter. ## Examples 下面的示例定义一个实现 `Temperature` 接口的 类。The following example defines a `Temperature` class that implements the interface. remarks.format: ## Remarks 是一种通用转换方法，它将 `value` 指定的对象转换为 `typeCode`指定的预定义类型。 is a general-purpose conversion method that converts the object specified by `value` to a predefined type specified by `typeCode`. `value` 参数可以是任何类型的对象。The `value` parameter can be an object of any type. 若要成功进行转换，`value` 必须实现 接口，因为方法只是包装对适当 方法的调用。For the conversion to succeed, `value` must implement the interface, because the method simply wraps a call to an appropriate method. 方法还要求 `value` 转换为 `typeCode`。The method also requires that conversion of `value` to `typeCode` be supported. 方法不支持将 `value` 转换为自定义类型。The method does not support the conversion of `value` to a custom type. 若要执行此类转换，请调用 方法。To perform such a conversion, call the method. `provider` 参数是为转换提供格式设置信息的 实现。The `provider` parameter is an implementation that supplies formatting information for the conversion. 是否以及如何使用此参数取决于基础 实现。Whether and how this parameter is used depends on the underlying implementation. 如果 `value` 是基本数据类型，则 `provider` 仅用于以下转换。If `value` is a base data type, `provider` is used only for the following conversions. 如果 `null` 参数传递给这些方法，则使用表示当前线程区域性的 对象。If a `null` argument is passed to these methods, the object that represents the current thread culture is used. - 从数字转换为字符串，或将字符串转换为数字。Conversion from a number to a string, or from a string to a number. `provider` 必须是 对象、 对象或返回 对象的自定义 实现。`provider` must be a object, a object, or a custom implementation that returns a object. 但是，由于 方法使用默认的 "G" 格式说明符执行转换，因此，如果 `value` 或目标类型为无符号整数，则 `provider` 参数不起作用。However, because the method performs the conversion using the default "G" format specifier, the `provider` parameter has no effect if `value` or the target type is an unsigned integer. - 从 值转换为字符串，或从字符串转换为 值。Conversion from a value to a string, or from a string to a value. `provider` 必须是 或 对象。`provider` must be a or object. 如果 `value` 是应用程序定义的类型，则其 实现可以使用 `provider` 参数。If `value` is an application-defined type, its implementation may use the `provider` parameter. ## Examples 下面的示例定义了一个名为 `InterceptProvider` 的自定义格式提供程序，该提供程序指示何时调用其 方法并为 fr-fr 区域性返回 ，并为 en-us 区域性返回 对象。The following example defines a custom format provider named `InterceptProvider` that indicates when its method is called and returns a for the fr-FR culture and a object for the en-US culture. 此格式提供程序用于对 方法的所有调用。This format provider is used in all calls to the method. 然后，该示例创建一个具有 和 值的数组，并使用每个值和 枚举的每个成员对 进行重复调用。The example then creates an array with a and a value and makes repeated calls to with each value and each member of the enumeration. 该示例阐释了方法何时使用 参数，并说明了如何使用 `provider` 参数执行区分区域性的格式设置。The example illustrates when the method uses the parameter and also illustrates the use of the `provider` parameter to perform culture-sensitive formatting. remarks.format: ## Remarks `inArray` 由64位、空白字符和尾随填充字符组成。`inArray` is composed of base-64 digits, white-space characters, and trailing padding characters. 以从零开始的升序顺序表示的大写字符为 "A" 到 "Z"、"a" 到 "z"、"0" 到 "9"、"+" 和 "/" 符号的大写字符。64The base-64 digits in ascending order from zero are the uppercase characters "A" to "Z", lowercase characters "a" to "z", numerals "0" to "9", and the symbols "+" and "/". 空白字符及其 Unicode 名称和十六进制码位是制表符（字符表、U + 0009）、换行符（换行符、U + 000A）、回车符（回车符、U + 000D）以及空白（空格、U + 0020）。The white-space characters, and their Unicode names and hexadecimal code points, are tab (CHARACTER TABULATION, U+0009), newline (LINE FEED, U+000A), carriage return (CARRIAGE RETURN, U+000D), and blank (SPACE, U+0020). `inArray` 中可能出现任意数量的空白字符，因为所有空白字符都将被忽略。An arbitrary number of white-space characters can appear in `inArray` because all white-space characters are ignored. 价值字符 "=" 用于尾随空白。The valueless character, "=", is used for trailing padding. `inArray` 的末尾可包含零个、一个或两个填充字符。The end of `inArray` can consist of zero, one, or two padding characters. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法旨在处理包含要解码的所有数据的单个字符数组。The method is designed to process a single character array that contains all the data to be decoded. 若要从流解码64字符数据，请使用 类。To decode base-64 character data from a stream, use the class. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用 方法来解码 Uuencode （64）数据，并将其另存为二进制输出。The following example demonstrates the use of the method to decode UUencoded (base-64) data and save it as binary output. [!code-cpp[System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions/CPP/class1.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions/CS/class1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions/VB/class1.vb#3)] 下面的示例演示 和 方法。The following example demonstrates the and methods. 输入分为三个字节（24位）的组。The input is divided into groups of three bytes (24 bits) each. 因此，每个组都由四个6位数字组成，其中每个数字的范围介于0到63之间。Consequently, each group consists of four 6-bit numbers where each number ranges from decimal 0 to 63. 在此示例中，有 85 3 个字节的组，剩余一个字节。In this example, there are 85 3-byte groups with one byte remaining. 第一个组包含十六进制值00、01和02，这会产生4个等于 decimal 0、0、4和2的6位值。The first group consists of the hexadecimal values 00, 01, and 02, which yield four 6-bit values equal to decimal 0, 0, 4, and 2. 这四个值对应于输出开头的64位、"A"、"A"、"E" 和 "C"。Those four values correspond to the base-64 digits, "A", "A", "E", and "C", at the beginning of the output. 如果不存在整数数量的3个字节的组，则将使用零来有效地填充剩余字节，以形成一个完整的组。If an integral number of 3-byte groups does not exist, the remaining bytes are effectively padded with zeros to form a complete group. 在此示例中，最后一个字节的值是十六进制的 FF。In this example, the value of the last byte is hexadecimal FF. 前6位等于 decimal 63，后者对应于输出末尾的64位 "/"，接下来的2位用零填充以生成十进制48，这64对应于 "w"、"w"。The first 6 bits are equal to decimal 63, which corresponds to the base-64 digit "/" at the end of the output, and the next 2 bits are padded with zeros to yield decimal 48, which corresponds to the base-64 digit, "w". 最后两个6位值是填充，对应于价值填充字符 "="。The last two 6-bit values are padding and correspond to the valueless padding character, "=". [!code-cpp[convert.tobase64chararray#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/convert.tobase64chararray/CPP/tb64ca.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[convert.tobase64chararray#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/convert.tobase64chararray/CS/tb64ca.cs#1)] [!code-vb[convert.tobase64chararray#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/convert.tobase64chararray/VB/tb64ca.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks `s` 由64位、空白字符和尾随填充字符组成。`s` is composed of base-64 digits, white-space characters, and trailing padding characters. 以从零开始的升序顺序表示的大写字符为 "A" 到 "Z"、"a" 到 "z"、"0" 到 "9"、"+" 和 "/" 符号的大写字符。64The base-64 digits in ascending order from zero are the uppercase characters "A" to "Z", lowercase characters "a" to "z", numerals "0" to "9", and the symbols "+" and "/". 空白字符及其 Unicode 名称和十六进制码位是制表符（字符表、U + 0009）、换行符（换行符、U + 000A）、回车符（回车符、U + 000D）以及空白（空格、U + 0020）。The white-space characters, and their Unicode names and hexadecimal code points, are tab (CHARACTER TABULATION, U+0009), newline (LINE FEED, U+000A), carriage return (CARRIAGE RETURN, U+000D), and blank (SPACE, U+0020). `s` 中可能出现任意数量的空白字符，因为所有空白字符都将被忽略。An arbitrary number of white-space characters can appear in `s` because all white-space characters are ignored. 价值字符 "=" 用于尾随空白。The valueless character, "=", is used for trailing padding. `s` 的末尾可包含零个、一个或两个填充字符。The end of `s` can consist of zero, one, or two padding characters. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法旨在处理包含要解码的所有数据的单个字符串。The method is designed to process a single string that contains all the data to be decoded. 若要从流解码64字符数据，请使用 类。To decode base-64 character data from a stream, use the class. ## Examples 下面的示例使用 方法将字节数组转换为 Uuencode （64）字符串，然后调用 方法来还原原始字节数组。The following example uses the method to convert a byte array to a UUencoded (base-64) string, and then calls the method to restore the original byte array. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToBase64String#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/cs/ToBase64String2.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToBase64String#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/vb/ToBase64String2.vb#1)] 下面是一个更复杂的示例，该示例创建了一个20元素的32位整数数组。The following is a more complex example that creates a 20-element array of 32-bit integers. 然后，它使用 方法将每个元素转换为一个字节数组，并通过调用 方法将其存储在缓冲区中的适当位置。It then uses the method to convert each element into a byte array, which it stores in the appropriate position in a buffer by calling the method. 然后，将此缓冲区传递到 方法，以创建 Uuencode （64）字符串。This buffer is then passed to the method to create a UUencoded (base-64) string. 然后，它调用 方法对 Uuencode 字符串进行解码，并调用 方法将四个字节（32位整数的大小）的每一组转换为整数。It then calls the method to decode the UUencoded string, and calls the method to convert each set of four bytes (the size of a 32-bit integer) to an integer. 该示例的输出显示已成功还原原始数组。The output from the example shows that the original array has been successfully restored. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToBase64String#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/cs/ToBase64String.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToBase64String#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/vb/ToBase64String.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法测试 `value` 参数是否与 相等。The method tests whether the `value` parameter is equal to . 它等效于以下代码：It is equivalent to the following code: [!code-csharp[System.Convert.IsDBNull#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.IsDBNull/cs/Form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.IsDBNull#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.IsDBNull/vb/Form1.vb#1)] > [!NOTE] > 用于指示缺少值。 is used to indicate a value that is missing. 它与 `null` 或 不等效。It is not equivalent to `null` or to . 因此，中的代码（如C# `Convert.IsDBNull(null)`）或 `Convert.IsDBNull(Nothing)` Visual Basic 将`false`返回。Therefore, code such as `Convert.IsDBNull(null)` in C# or `Convert.IsDBNull(Nothing)` in Visual Basic returns`false`. ## Examples 下面的示例使用 对象从数据库中检索调查数据。The following example uses a object to retrieve survey data from a database. 它将每个行的字段值分配给一个数组，然后将每个数组元素传递到 方法。It assigns each row's field values to an array, and then passes each array element to the method. 如果该方法返回 `true`，则该示例将字符串 "NA" 赋给数组元素。If the method returns `true`, the example assigns the string "NA" to the array element. 然后，将数组添加到 控件的 集合。The array is then added to the collection of a control. remarks.format: ## Remarks 从位置 `offsetIn`开始 `inArray` `length` 元素的子集作为数值，并转换为 `outArray` 从位置 `offsetOut`开始的元素子集。The subset of `length` elements of `inArray` starting at position `offsetIn`, are taken as a numeric value and converted to a subset of elements in `outArray` starting at position `offsetOut`. 返回值指示 `outArray`中转换后的元素的数目。The return value indicates the number of converted elements in `outArray`. `outArray` 的子集包含64位数字。The subset of `outArray` consists of base-64 digits. 以从零开始的升序排序的以-64 的数字为大写字母 "A" 到 "Z"，小写字符 "a" 到 "z"，数字 "0" 到 "9"，以及符号 "+" 和 "/"。The base-64 digits in ascending order from zero are the uppercase characters "A" to "Z", the lowercase characters "a" to "z", the numerals "0" to "9", and the symbols "+" and "/". 价值字符 "=" 用于尾随空白。The valueless character, "=", is used for trailing padding. `offset` 和 `length` 参数是32位有符号数字。The `offset` and `length` parameters are 32-bit signed numbers. `offsetIn` 和 `offsetOut` 参数是从零开始的数组位置。The `offsetIn` and `offsetOut` parameters are zero-based array positions. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法旨在处理包含要编码的所有数据的单字节数组。The method is designed to process a single byte array that contains all the data to be encoded. 若要从字节流创建 base-64 字符数组，请使用 类。To create a base-64 character array from a byte stream, use the class. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用 方法在二进制流中进行 UUencode （编码为64），然后将编码保存到文件。The following example demonstrates using the method to UUencode (encode in base 64) a binary stream, then save the encoding to a file. [!code-cpp[System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions/CPP/class1.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions/CS/class1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert UUEncodeDecode functions/VB/class1.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 从位置 `offsetIn`开始 `inArray` 参数 `length` 元素的子集作为数值，并转换为 `outArray` 参数中从位置 `offsetOut`开始的元素子集。The subset of `length` elements of the `inArray` parameter starting at position `offsetIn`, are taken as a numeric value and converted to a subset of elements in the `outArray` parameter starting at position `offsetOut`. 返回值指示 `outArray`中转换后的元素的数目。The return value indicates the number of converted elements in `outArray`. `outArray` 的子集包含64位数字。The subset of `outArray` consists of base-64 digits. 以从零开始的升序排序的以-64 的数字为大写字母 "A" 到 "Z"，小写字符 "a" 到 "z"，数字 "0" 到 "9"，以及符号 "+" 和 "/"。The base-64 digits in ascending order from zero are the uppercase characters "A" to "Z", the lowercase characters "a" to "z", the numerals "0" to "9", and the symbols "+" and "/". 价值字符 "=" 用于尾随空白。The valueless character "=" is used for trailing padding. `offset` 和 `length` 参数是32位有符号数字。The `offset` and `length` parameters are 32-bit signed numbers. `offsetIn` 和 `offsetOut` 参数是从零开始的数组位置。The `offsetIn` and `offsetOut` parameters are zero-based array positions. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法旨在处理包含要编码的所有数据的单字节数组。The method is designed to process a single byte array that contains all the data to be encoded. 若要从字节流创建 base-64 字符数组，请使用 类。To create a base-64 character array from a byte stream, use the class. 如果 `options` 参数设置为 并且转换的输出长度超过76个字符，则每76个字符插入一个换行符。If the `options` parameter is set to and the output of the conversion is longer than 76 characters, a line break is inserted every 76 characters. 换行符定义为回车符（U + 000D），后跟换行符（U + 000A）。A line break is defined as a carriage return character (U+000D) followed by a line feed character (U+000A). 有关详细信息，请参阅 RFC 2045 "多用途 Internet 邮件扩展"， [https://www.rfc-editor.org/](https://www.rfc-editor.org/)。For more information, see RFC 2045, "Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions", at [https://www.rfc-editor.org/](https://www.rfc-editor.org/). ## Examples 下面的示例演示 方法。The following example demonstrates the method. 输入分为三个字节（24位）的组。The input is divided into groups of three bytes (24 bits) each. 因此，每个组都由四个6位数字组成，其中每个数字的范围介于0到63之间。Consequently, each group consists of four 6-bit numbers where each number ranges from decimal 0 to 63. 在此示例中，有 85 3 个字节的组，剩余一个字节。In this example, there are 85 3-byte groups with one byte remaining. 第一个组包含十六进制值00、01和02，这会产生4个等于 decimal 0、0、4和2的6位值。The first group consists of the hexadecimal values 00, 01, and 02, which yield four 6-bit values equal to decimal 0, 0, 4, and 2. 这四个值对应于输出开头的64位 "A"、"A"、"E" 和 "C"。Those four values correspond to the base-64 digits "A", "A", "E", and "C" at the beginning of the output. 如果不存在整数数量的3个字节的组，则将使用零来有效地填充剩余字节，以形成一个完整的组。If an integral number of 3-byte groups does not exist, the remaining bytes are effectively padded with zeros to form a complete group. 在此示例中，最后一个字节的值是十六进制的 FF。In this example, the value of the last byte is hexadecimal FF. 前6位等于 decimal 63，后者对应于输出末尾的64位 "/"，接下来的2位用零填充以生成十进制48，这64对应于 "w"、"w"。The first 6 bits are equal to decimal 63, which corresponds to the base-64 digit "/" at the end of the output, and the next 2 bits are padded with zeros to yield decimal 48, which corresponds to the base-64 digit, "w". 最后两个6位值是填充，对应于价值填充字符 "="。The last two 6-bit values are padding and correspond to the valueless padding character, "=". [!code-cpp[convert.tobase64chararray#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/convert.tobase64chararray/CPP/tb64ca.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[convert.tobase64chararray#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/convert.tobase64chararray/CS/tb64ca.cs#1)] [!code-vb[convert.tobase64chararray#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/convert.tobase64chararray/VB/tb64ca.vb#1)]

summary.span: Converts an array of 8-bit unsigned integers to its equivalent string representation that is encoded with base-64 digits.

span.span: Converts an array of 8-bit unsigned integers to its equivalent string representation that is encoded with base-64 digits.

returns.span: The string representation, in base 64, of the contents of .

span.span: The string representation, in base 64, of the contents of .

remarks.format: ## Remarks `inArray` 的元素被视为数值，并转换为以64位数字编码的字符串表示形式。The elements of `inArray` are taken as a numeric value and converted to a string representation that is encoded with base-64 digits. 以从零开始的升序排序的以-64 的数字为大写字母 "A" 到 "Z"，小写字符 "a" 到 "z"，数字 "0" 到 "9"，以及符号 "+" 和 "/"。The base-64 digits in ascending order from zero are the uppercase characters "A" to "Z", the lowercase characters "a" to "z", the numerals "0" to "9", and the symbols "+" and "/". 价值字符 "=" 用于尾随空白。The valueless character, "=", is used for trailing padding. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法旨在处理包含要编码的所有数据的单字节数组。The method is designed to process a single byte array that contains all the data to be encoded. 若要对流中的数据进行编码，请使用 类。To encode data from a stream, use the class. 通常， 方法不用于往返 Uuencode （以64编码的字符串）。Ordinarily, the method is not used to round-trip a UUEncoded (base-64 encoded) string. 也就是说，如果通过调用 方法对字符串进行解码，然后通过调用 方法对返回的字节数组进行编码，则生成的字符串不一定与原始字符串完全相同。That is, if you decode a string by calling the method, then encode the returned byte array by calling the method, the resulting string will not necessarily be identical to the original string. 仅当原始字符串是有效的 base-64 编码字符串时，字符串才会往返。The string will round-trip only if the original string is a valid base-64 encoded string. ## Examples 下面的示例使用 方法将字节数组转换为 Uuencode （64）字符串，然后调用 方法来还原原始字节数组。The following example uses the method to convert a byte array to a UUencoded (base-64) string, and then calls the method to restore the original byte array. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToBase64String#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/cs/ToBase64String2.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToBase64String#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/vb/ToBase64String2.vb#1)] 下面是一个更复杂的示例，该示例创建了一个20元素的32位整数数组。The following is a more complex example that creates a 20-element array of 32-bit integers. 然后，它使用 方法将每个元素转换为一个字节数组，并通过调用 方法将其存储在缓冲区中的适当位置。It then uses the method to convert each element into a byte array, which it stores in the appropriate position in a buffer by calling the method. 然后，将此缓冲区传递到 方法，以创建 Uuencode （64）字符串。This buffer is then passed to the method to create a UUencoded (base-64) string. 然后，它调用 方法对 Uuencode 字符串进行解码，并调用 方法将四个字节（32位整数的大小）的每一组转换为整数。It then calls the method to decode the UUencoded string, and calls the method to convert each set of four bytes (the size of a 32-bit integer) to an integer. 该示例的输出显示已成功还原原始数组。The output from the example shows that the original array has been successfully restored. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToBase64String#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/cs/ToBase64String.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToBase64String#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/vb/ToBase64String.vb#2)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks `inArray` 参数的元素被当作数值，并转换为字符串表示形式，其形式为64。The elements of the `inArray` parameter are taken as a numeric value and converted to a string representation in base 64. 以从零开始的升序排序的以-64 的数字为大写字母 "A" 到 "Z"，小写字符 "a" 到 "z"，数字 "0" 到 "9"，以及符号 "+" 和 "/"。The base-64 digits in ascending order from zero are the uppercase characters "A" to "Z", the lowercase characters "a" to "z", the numerals "0" to "9", and the symbols "+" and "/". 价值字符 "=" 用于尾随空白。The valueless character "=" is used for trailing padding. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法旨在处理包含要编码的所有数据的单字节数组。The method is designed to process a single byte array that contains all the data to be encoded. 若要对流中的数据进行编码，请使用 类。To encode data from a stream, use the class. 如果 `options` 参数设置为 并且转换的输出长度超过76个字符，则每76个字符插入一个换行符。If the `options` parameter is set to and the output of the conversion is longer than 76 characters, a line break is inserted every 76 characters. 换行符定义为回车符（U + 000D），后跟换行符（U + 000A）。A line break is defined as a carriage return character (U+000D) followed by a line feed character (U+000A). 由于分行符在64编码中被视为空白字符，因此在将 base-64 编码的字符串转换回字节数组时，它们将被忽略。Because line breaks are considered white-space characters in a base-64 encoding, they are ignored when converting a base-64 encoded string back to a byte array. 在将编码的字符串显示到控件或设备（如控制台窗口）中时，分行符只是很方便。The line breaks are simply convenient when displaying the encoded string to a control or a device such as a console window. 有关详细信息，请参阅 RFC 2045 "多用途 Internet 邮件扩展"， [https://www.rfc-editor.org/](https://www.rfc-editor.org/)。For more information, see RFC 2045, "Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions", at [https://www.rfc-editor.org/](https://www.rfc-editor.org/). ## Examples 下面的示例使用 参数调用 ，以在通过编码100元素的字节数组生成的字符串中插入分行符。The following example calls the with a argument to insert line breaks in the string that is produced by encoding a 100-element byte array. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToBase64String#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/cs/ToBase64String3.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToBase64String#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/System.Convert.ToBase64String/vb/ToBase64String3.vb#3)] 如示例的输出所示， 成功还原原始字节数组;在转换过程中将忽略换行符。As the output from the example shows, the succeeds in restoring the original byte array; the line break characters are ignored during the conversion.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `inArray` 的元素被当作数值，并转换为以64为基准的字符串表示形式。The elements of `inArray` are taken as a numeric value and converted to a string representation in base 64. 以从零开始的升序排序的以-64 的数字为大写字母 "A" 到 "Z"，小写字符 "a" 到 "z"，数字 "0" 到 "9"，以及符号 "+" 和 "/"。The base-64 digits in ascending order from zero are the uppercase characters "A" to "Z", the lowercase characters "a" to "z", the numerals "0" to "9", and the symbols "+" and "/". 价值字符 "=" 用于尾随空白。The valueless character, "=", is used for trailing padding. `offset` 和 `length` 参数是32位有符号数字。The `offset` and `length` parameters are 32-bit signed numbers. `offset` 参数是从零开始的。The `offset` parameter is zero-based. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法旨在处理包含要编码的所有数据的单字节数组。The method is designed to process a single byte array that contains all the data to be encoded. 若要对流中的数据进行编码，请使用 类。To encode data from a stream, use the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `inArray` 参数的元素被当作数值，并转换为字符串表示形式，其形式为64。The elements of the `inArray` parameter are taken as a numeric value and converted to a string representation in base 64. 以从零开始的升序排序的以-64 的数字为大写字母 "A" 到 "Z"，小写字符 "a" 到 "z"，数字 "0" 到 "9"，以及符号 "+" 和 "/"。The base-64 digits in ascending order from zero are the uppercase characters "A" to "Z", the lowercase characters "a" to "z", the numerals "0" to "9", and the symbols "+" and "/". 价值字符 "=" 用于尾随空白。The valueless character "=" is used for trailing padding. `offset` 和 `length` 参数是32位有符号数字。The `offset` and `length` parameters are 32-bit signed numbers. `offset` 参数是从零开始的。The `offset` parameter is zero-based. > [!IMPORTANT] > 方法旨在处理包含要编码的所有数据的单字节数组。The method is designed to process a single byte array that contains all the data to be encoded. 若要对流中的数据进行编码，请使用 类。To encode data from a stream, use the class. 如果 `options` 参数设置为 并且转换的输出长度超过76个字符，则每76个字符插入一个换行符。If the `options` parameter is set to and the output of the conversion is longer than 76 characters, a line break is inserted every 76 characters. 换行符定义为回车符（U + 000D），后跟换行符（U + 000A）。A line break is defined as a carriage return character (U+000D) followed by a line feed character (U+000A). 有关详细信息，请参阅 RFC 2045 "多用途 Internet 邮件扩展"， [https://www.rfc-editor.org/](https://www.rfc-editor.org/)。For more information, see RFC 2045, "Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions", at [https://www.rfc-editor.org/](https://www.rfc-editor.org/). ## Examples 下面的示例演示 方法。The following example demonstrates the method. 输入分为三个字节（24位）的组。The input is divided into groups of three bytes (24 bits) each. 因此，每个组都由四个6位数字组成，其中每个数字的范围介于0到63之间。Consequently, each group consists of four 6-bit numbers where each number ranges from decimal 0 to 63. 在此示例中，有 85 3 个字节的组，剩余一个字节。In this example, there are 85 3-byte groups with one byte remaining. 第一个组包含十六进制值00、01和02，这会产生4个等于 decimal 0、0、4和2的6位值。The first group consists of the hexadecimal values 00, 01, and 02, which yield four 6-bit values equal to decimal 0, 0, 4, and 2. 这四个值对应于输出开头的64位 "A"、"A"、"E" 和 "C"。Those four values correspond to the base-64 digits "A", "A", "E", and "C" at the beginning of the output. 如果不存在整数数量的3个字节的组，则将使用零来有效地填充剩余字节，以形成一个完整的组。If an integral number of 3-byte groups does not exist, the remaining bytes are effectively padded with zeros to form a complete group. 在此示例中，最后一个字节的值是十六进制的 FF。In this example, the value of the last byte is hexadecimal FF. 前6位等于 decimal 63，后者对应于输出末尾的64位 "/"，接下来的2位用零填充以生成十进制48，这64对应于 "w"、"w"。The first 6 bits are equal to decimal 63, which corresponds to the base-64 digit "/" at the end of the output, and the next 2 bits are padded with zeros to yield decimal 48, which corresponds to the base-64 digit, "w". 最后两个6位值是填充，对应于价值填充字符 "="。The last two 6-bit values are padding and correspond to the valueless padding character, "=". remarks.format: ## Remarks `provider` 使用户能够指定与 `value`内容有关的区域性特定的转换信息。`provider` enables the user to specify culture-specific conversion information about the contents of `value`. 基类型忽略 `provider`;但是，如果 `value` 是实现 接口的用户定义类型，则可以使用参数。The base types ignore `provider`; however, the parameter may be used if `value` is a user-defined type that implements the interface. ## Examples 下面的示例定义一个实现 `ByteString` 接口的 类。The following example defines a `ByteString` class that implements the interface. 类存储字节值的字符串表示形式和符号字段，使其能够表示有符号和无符号的字节值。The class stores the string representation of a byte value along with a sign field, so that it is able to represent both signed and unsigned byte values. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToByte#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tobyte/cs/tobyte3.cs#12)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToByte#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tobyte/vb/tobyte3.vb#12)] 下面的示例实例化多个 `ByteString` 对象，并调用 方法将其转换为字节值。The following example instantiates several `ByteString` objects and calls the method to convert them to byte values. 它说明 方法包装对要转换的对象的 方法的调用。It illustrates that the method wraps a call to the method of the object to be converted. remarks.format: ## Remarks `provider` 是获取 对象的 实例。`provider` is an instance that obtains a object. 对象提供有关 `value`格式的区域性特定信息。The object provides culture-specific information about the format of `value`. 如果 `null``provider`，则使用当前区域性的 对象。If `provider` is `null`, the object for the current culture is used. 如果你不希望在转换失败时处理异常，则可以改为调用 方法。If you prefer not to handle an exception if the conversion fails, you can call the method instead. 它将返回一个 值，该值指示转换是成功还是失败。It returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed. ## Examples 下面的示例创建一个自定义 对象，该对象将正号定义为 "pos"，将负号定义为 "neg"，它将在对 方法的调用中使用。The following example creates a custom object that defines the positive sign as "pos" and the negative sign as "neg", which it uses in calls to the method. 然后，它将重复调用 方法，将字符串数组中的每个元素转换为 值。It then calls the method repeatedly to convert each element in a string array to a value. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToByte#14](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tobyte/cs/tobyte4.cs#14)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToByte#14](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tobyte/vb/tobyte4.vb#14)]

span.span: An 8-bit unsigned integer that is equivalent to the number in , or 0 (zero) if is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果 `fromBase` 为16，则可以使用 "0x" 或 "0X" 作为 `value` 参数指定的数字的前缀。If `fromBase` is 16, you can prefix the number specified by the `value` parameter with "0x" or "0X". 由于 的数据类型仅支持未签名的值，因此 方法假定 `value` 是使用无符号二进制表示形式表示的。Because the data type supports unsigned values only, the method assumes that `value` is expressed using unsigned binary representation. 换句话说，所有八位都用来表示数值，并且不存在符号位。In other words, all eight bits are used to represent the numeric value, and a sign bit is absent. 因此，可以编写代码，在此代码中，将超出 数据类型范围的带符号字节值转换为 值，而不会引发异常。As a result, it is possible to write code in which a signed byte value that is out of the range of the data type is converted to a value without the method throwing an exception. 下面的示例将 转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式，然后调用 方法。The following example converts to its hexadecimal string representation, and then calls the method. 方法会显示消息 "0x80 转换为 128"，而不是引发异常。Instead of throwing an exception, the method displays the message, "0x80 converts to 128." [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#3)] 执行二元运算或数值转换时，开发人员始终负责验证方法或运算符是否使用适当的数值表示形式来解释特定值。When performing binary operations or numeric conversions, it is always the responsibility of the developer to verify that a method or operator is using the appropriate numeric representation to interpret a particular value. 下面的示例演示了一种方法，用于确保在将十六进制字符串表示形式转换为 值时，方法不会不当使用未签名的二进制表示形式。The following example illustrates one technique for ensuring that the method does not inappropriately use unsigned binary representation when it converts a hexadecimal string representation to a value. 该示例在将值转换为其字符串表示形式时，确定某个值是否表示有符号或无符号整数。The example determines whether a value represents a signed or an unsigned integer while it is converting that value to its string representation. 当示例将该值转换回 值时，它会检查原始值是否为有符号整数。When the example converts the value back to a value, it checks whether the original value was a signed integer. 如果是这样，并且如果设置了其高顺序位（这表示该值为负数，且使用了2的补码而不是无符号的二进制表示形式），该方法将引发异常。If so, and if its high-order bit is set (which indicates that the value is negative and that it uses two's complement instead of unsigned binary representation), the method throws an exception. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#4)] ## Examples 下面的示例交替尝试将字符串数组解释为二进制、八进制、十进制和十六进制值的表示形式。The following example alternately attempts to interpret an array of strings as the representation of binary, octal, decimal, and hexadecimal values. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToByte#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tobyte/cs/tobyte2.cs#11)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToByte#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tobyte/vb/tobyte2.vb#11)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要成功转换，`value` 参数的运行时类型必须是 或 ，或者必须 `null``value`。For the conversion to succeed, the runtime type of the `value` parameter must be either a or a , or `value` must be `null`. 否则，该方法将引发 。Otherwise, the method throws an . 此外，如果 `value` 是字符串，则它必须包含当前区域性中的日期和时间值的有效表示形式，否则将引发 。In addition, if `value` is a string, it must contain a valid representation of a date and time value in the current culture or a is thrown. 返回值是调用的基础类型 `value`的 方法的结果。The return value is the result of invoking the method of the underlying type of `value`. ## Examples 下面的示例使用各种 变量调用 方法。The following example calls the method with a variety of variables. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果未 `null``value`，则返回值是使用为当前区域性初始化的 对象中的格式设置信息对 `value` 调用 方法的结果。If `value` is not `null`, the return value is the result of invoking the method on `value` using the formatting information in a object that is initialized for the current culture. `value` 参数必须以 主题中所述的格式之一包含日期和时间的表示形式。The `value` argument must contain the representation of a date and time in one of the formats described in the topic. 如果 `value` 为 `null`，则此方法返回 。If `value` is `null`, the method returns . 此方法尝试完全分析 `value`，避免引发 。This method tries to parse `value` completely and avoid throwing a . 它完成缺少包含当前日期的月、日和年信息。It completes missing month, day, and year information with the current date. 如果 `value` 只包含日期而不包含时间，则此方法假定时间为午夜。If `value` contains only a date and no time, this method assumes a time of midnight. `value` 中的所有前导、内部或尾随空白字符都将被忽略。Any leading, inner, or trailing white-space characters in `value` are ignored. 如果你不希望在转换失败时处理异常，则可以改为调用 方法。If you prefer not to handle an exception if the conversion fails, you can call the method instead. 它将返回一个 值，该值指示转换是成功还是失败。It returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed. ## Examples 下面的示例使用 方法将日期和时间的各种字符串表示形式转换为 值。The following example uses the method to convert various string representations of dates and times to values. remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值是调用的基础类型 `value`的 方法的结果。The return value is the result of invoking the method of the underlying type of `value`. `provider` 使用户能够指定与 `value`内容有关的区域性特定的转换信息。`provider` enables the user to specify culture-specific conversion information about the contents of `value`. 例如，如果 `value` 是表示日期的 ，则 `provider` 可能会提供有关用于表示该日期的表示法的区域性特定信息。For example, if `value` is a that represents a date, `provider` could supply culture-specific information about the notation used to represent that date. 如果 `value` 的运行时类型是 ，则 `provider` 涉及到 `value` 的转换; 如果 `value` 是用户定义的类型，其 实现利用 `provider`，则该类型为。`provider` is involved in the conversion of `value` if the runtime type of `value` is a , or if `value` is a user-defined type whose implementation makes use of `provider`. 如果 `value` 的运行时类型为 并 `null``provider`，则使用表示当前线程区域性的 对象。If the runtime type of `value` is and `provider` is `null`, the object that represents the current thread culture is used. ## Examples 下面的示例定义了一个自定义格式提供程序，`CustomProvider`，其 方法将消息输出到已调用的控制台，然后返回其名称作为参数传递给其类构造函数的区域性的 对象。The following example defines a custom format provider, `CustomProvider`, whose method outputs a message to the console that it has been invoked, and then returns the object of the culture whose name was passed as a parameter to its class constructor. 其中每个 `CustomProvider` 对象用于将对象数组中的元素转换为日期和时间值。Each of these `CustomProvider` objects is used to convert the elements in an object array to date and time values. 输出表明仅当 `value` 参数的类型是 时，才在转换中使用 `CustomProvider` 对象。The output indicates that the `CustomProvider` object is used in the conversion only when the type of the `value` parameter is a . remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值是调用的基础类型 `value`的 方法的结果。The return value is the result of invoking the method of the underlying type of `value`. `provider` 使用户能够指定与 `value`内容有关的区域性特定的转换信息。`provider` enables the user to specify culture-specific conversion information about the contents of `value`. 例如，如果 `value` 是表示数字的 ，则 `provider` 可能会提供有关用于表示该数字的表示法的特定于区域性的信息。For example, if `value` is a that represents a number, `provider` could supply culture-specific information about the notation used to represent that number. 基类型忽略 `provider`;但是，如果 `value` 是实现 接口的用户定义类型，则可以使用参数。The base types ignore `provider`; however, the parameter may be used if `value` is a user-defined type that implements the interface. ## Examples 下面的示例定义了一个类，该类实现 和实现 的类。The following example defines a class that implements and a class that implements . 实现 类的对象保存 值的数组。Objects of the class that implements hold an array of values. 将每个类的对象传递给 `ToDouble` 方法。An object of each class is passed to the `ToDouble` method. 此方法使用实现 的对象来确定如何计算平均值，从而返回 值数组的平均值。This method returns an average of the array of values, using the object that implements to determine how to calculate the average. remarks.format: ## Remarks `provider` 使用户能够指定与 `value`内容有关的区域性特定的转换信息。`provider` enables the user to specify culture-specific conversion information about the contents of `value`. 例如，如果 `value` 是表示数字的 ，则 `provider` 可能会提供有关用于表示该数字的表示法的特定于区域性的信息。For example, if `value` is a that represents a number, `provider` could supply culture-specific information about the notation used to represent that number. 基类型忽略 `provider`;但是，如果 `value` 是实现 接口的用户定义类型，则可以使用参数。The base types ignore `provider`; however, the parameter may be used if `value` is a user-defined type that implements the interface. ## Examples 下面的示例定义了一个类，该类实现 和实现 的类。The following example defines a class that implements and a class that implements . 实现 类的对象保存 值的数组。Objects of the class that implements hold an array of values. 将每个类的对象传递给 `ToInt16` 方法。An object of each class is passed to the `ToInt16` method. 此方法使用实现 的对象来确定如何计算平均值，从而返回 值数组的平均值。This method returns an average of the array of values, using the object that implements to determine how to calculate the average. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果 `fromBase` 为16，则可以使用 "0x" 或 "0X" 作为 `value` 参数指定的数字的前缀。If `fromBase` is 16, you can prefix the number specified by the `value` parameter with "0x" or "0X". 由于非 base 10 数值表示形式不支持负号，因此 方法假设负数使用两个的补数表示形式。Because the negative sign is not supported for non-base 10 numeric representations, the method assumes that negative numbers use two's complement representation. 换言之，该方法始终将整数（位15）的最高顺序二进制位解释为其符号位。In other words, the method always interprets the highest-order binary bit of an integer (bit 15) as its sign bit. 因此，可以编写代码，在此代码中，如果不是由方法引发异常，则将不在 数据类型范围内的非基数10的数字转换为 值。As a result, it is possible to write code in which a non-base 10 number that is out of the range of the data type is converted to an value without the method throwing an exception. 下面的示例将 递增一，将得到的数字转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式，然后调用 方法。The following example increments by one, converts the resulting number to its hexadecimal string representation, and then calls the method. 方法不会引发异常，而是显示消息 "0x8000 转换为-32768"。Instead of throwing an exception, the method displays the message, "0x8000 converts to -32768." [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#5)] 执行二元运算或数值转换时，开发人员始终负责验证方法是否使用适当的数值表示形式来解释特定值。When performing binary operations or numeric conversions, it is always the responsibility of the developer to verify that a method is using the appropriate numeric representation to interpret a particular value. 如下面的示例所示，通过先检索数值的符号，然后将其转换为十六进制字符串表示形式，可以确保方法适当地处理溢出。As the following example illustrates, you can ensure that the method handles overflows appropriately by first retrieving the sign of the numeric value before converting it to its hexadecimal string representation. 如果原始值为正值，但转换回整数产生负值，则引发异常。Throw an exception if the original value was positive but the conversion back to an integer yields a negative value. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#6)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#6](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#6)] ## Examples 下面的示例尝试将字符串数组中的每个元素解释为十六进制字符串，并将其转换为16位带符号整数。The following example attempts to interpret each element in a string array as a hexadecimal string and to convert it to a 16-bit signed integer. remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值是调用的基础类型 `value`的 方法的结果。The return value is the result of invoking the method of the underlying type of `value`. `provider` 使用户能够指定与 `value`内容有关的区域性特定的转换信息。`provider` enables the user to specify culture-specific conversion information about the contents of `value`. 例如，如果 `value` 是表示数字的 ，则 `provider` 可能会提供有关用于表示该数字的表示法的特定于区域性的信息。For example, if `value` is a that represents a number, `provider` could supply culture-specific information about the notation used to represent that number. 基类型忽略 `provider`;但是，如果 `value` 是实现 接口的用户定义类型，则可以使用参数。The base types ignore `provider`; however, the parameter may be used if `value` is a user-defined type that implements the interface. ## Examples 下面的示例定义了一个类，该类实现 和实现 的类。The following example defines a class that implements and a class that implements . 实现 类的对象保存 值的数组。Objects of the class that implements hold an array of values. 将每个类的对象传递给 `ToInt32` 方法。An object of each class is passed to the `ToInt32` method. 此方法使用实现 的对象来确定如何计算平均值，从而返回 值数组的平均值。This method returns an average of the array of values, using the object that implements to determine how to calculate the average. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果 `fromBase` 为16，则可以使用 "0x" 或 "0X" 作为 `value` 参数指定的数字的前缀。If `fromBase` is 16, you can prefix the number specified by the `value` parameter with "0x" or "0X". 由于非 base 10 数值表示形式不支持负号，因此 方法假设负数使用两个的补数表示形式。Because the negative sign is not supported for non-base 10 numeric representations, the method assumes that negative numbers use two's complement representation. 换言之，该方法始终将整数（位31）的最高顺序二进制位解释为其符号位。In other words, the method always interprets the highest-order binary bit of an integer (bit 31) as its sign bit. 因此，可以编写代码，在此代码中，如果不是由方法引发异常，则将不在 数据类型范围内的非基数10的数字转换为 值。As a result, it is possible to write code in which a non-base 10 number that is out of the range of the data type is converted to an value without the method throwing an exception. 下面的示例将 递增一，将得到的数字转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式，然后调用 方法。The following example increments by one, converts the resulting number to its hexadecimal string representation, and then calls the method. 方法会显示消息 "0x80000000 转换为-2147483648"，而不是引发异常。Instead of throwing an exception, the method displays the message, "0x80000000 converts to -2147483648." [!code-cpp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cpp/toint_str_int32.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#1)] 执行二元运算或数值转换时，开发人员始终负责验证方法是否使用适当的数值表示形式来解释特定值。When performing binary operations or numeric conversions, it is always the responsibility of the developer to verify that a method is using the appropriate numeric representation to interpret a particular value. 如下面的示例所示，通过先检索数值的符号，然后将其转换为十六进制字符串表示形式，可以确保方法适当地处理溢出。As the following example illustrates, you can ensure that the method handles overflows appropriately by first retrieving the sign of the numeric value before converting it to its hexadecimal string representation. 如果原始值为正值，但转换回整数产生负值，则引发异常。Throw an exception if the original value was positive but the conversion back to an integer yields a negative value. remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值是调用的基础类型 `value`的 方法的结果。The return value is the result of invoking the method of the underlying type of `value`. `provider` 使用户能够指定与 `value`内容有关的区域性特定的转换信息。`provider` enables the user to specify culture-specific conversion information about the contents of `value`. 例如，如果 `value` 是表示数字的 ，则 `provider` 可能会提供有关用于表示该数字的表示法的特定于区域性的信息。For example, if `value` is a that represents a number, `provider` could supply culture-specific information about the notation used to represent that number. 基类型忽略 `provider`;但是，如果 `value` 是实现 接口的用户定义类型，则可以使用参数。The base types ignore `provider`; however, the parameter may be used if `value` is a user-defined type that implements the interface. ## Examples 下面的示例定义了一个类，该类实现 和实现 的类。The following example defines a class that implements and a class that implements . 实现 类的对象保存 值的数组。Objects of the class that implements hold an array of values. 将每个类的对象传递给 `ToInt64` 方法。An object of each class is passed to the `ToInt64` method. 此方法使用实现 的对象来确定如何计算平均值，从而返回 值数组的平均值。This method returns an average of the array of values, using the object that implements to determine how to calculate the average. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果 `fromBase` 为16，则可以使用 "0x" 或 "0X" 作为 `value` 参数指定的数字的前缀。If `fromBase` is 16, you can prefix the number specified by the `value` parameter with "0x" or "0X". 由于非 base 10 数值表示形式不支持负号，因此 方法假设负数使用两个的补数表示形式。Because the negative sign is not supported for non-base 10 numeric representations, the method assumes that negative numbers use two's complement representation. 换言之，该方法始终将长整数（位63）的最高顺序二进制位解释为其符号位。In other words, the method always interprets the highest-order binary bit of a long integer (bit 63) as its sign bit. 因此，可以编写代码，在此代码中，如果不是由方法引发异常，则将不在 数据类型范围内的非基数10的数字转换为 值。As a result, it is possible to write code in which a non-base 10 number that is out of the range of the data type is converted to an value without the method throwing an exception. 下面的示例将 转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式，然后调用 方法。The following example converts to its hexadecimal string representation, and then calls the method. 方法会显示消息 "0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF 转换为-1"，而不是引发异常。Instead of throwing an exception, the method displays the message, "0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF converts to -1." [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#7)] 执行二元运算或数值转换时，开发人员始终负责验证方法是否使用适当的数值表示形式来解释特定值。When performing binary operations or numeric conversions, it is always the responsibility of the developer to verify that a method is using the appropriate numeric representation to interpret a particular value. 如下面的示例所示，你可以通过在将值转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式之前，通过确定值是否表示无符号或带符号类型，来确保方法正确地处理溢出。As the following example illustrates, you can ensure that the method handles overflows appropriately by first determining whether a value represents an unsigned or a signed type when converting it to its hexadecimal string representation. 如果原始值是无符号类型，但转换回整数时产生的值为 on，则引发异常。Throw an exception if the original value was an unsigned type but the conversion back to an integer yields a value whose sign bit is on. remarks.format: ## Remarks `provider` 使用户能够指定与 `value`内容有关的区域性特定的转换信息。`provider` enables the user to specify culture-specific conversion information about the contents of `value`. 例如，如果 `value` 是表示数字的 ，则 `provider` 可能会提供有关用于表示该数字的表示法的特定于区域性的信息。For example, if `value` is a that represents a number, `provider` could supply culture-specific information about the notation used to represent that number. 基类型忽略 `provider`;但是，如果 `value` 是实现 接口的用户定义类型，则可以使用参数。The base types ignore `provider`; however, the parameter may be used if `value` is a user-defined type that implements the interface. ## Examples 下面的示例定义了一个 `ByteString` 类，该类将有符号和无符号字节存储为十六进制字符串以及指示字节符号的字段。The following example defines a `ByteString` class that stores both signed and unsigned bytes as hexadecimal strings along with a field that indicates the sign of the byte. `ByteString` 类实现 接口。The `ByteString` class implements the interface. 它的 方法调用 方法来执行转换。Its method calls the method to perform the conversion. 如果失败，则会引发 。If it fails, it throws an . remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果 `fromBase` 为16，则可以使用 "0x" 或 "0X" 作为 `value` 参数指定的数字的前缀。If `fromBase` is 16, you can prefix the number specified by the `value` parameter with "0x" or "0X". 由于非 base 10 数值表示形式不支持负号，因此 方法假设负数使用两个的补数表示形式。Because the negative sign is not supported for non-base 10 numeric representations, the method assumes that negative numbers use two's complement representation. 换言之，该方法始终将字节（第7）的高序位解释为其符号位。In other words, the method always interprets the high-order bit of a byte (bit 7) as its sign bit. 因此，可以编写代码，在此代码中，如果不是由方法引发异常，则将不在 数据类型范围内的非基数10的数字转换为 值。As a result, it is possible to write code in which a non-base 10 number that is out of the range of the data type is converted to an value without the method throwing an exception. 下面的示例将 转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式，然后调用 方法。The following example converts to its hexadecimal string representation, and then calls the method. 方法会显示消息 "0xff 转换为-1"，而不是引发异常。Instead of throwing an exception, the method displays the message, "0xff converts to -1." [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#9](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#9)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#9](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#9)] 执行二元运算或数值转换时，开发人员始终负责验证方法是否使用适当的数值表示形式来解释特定值。When performing binary operations or numeric conversions, it is always the responsibility of the developer to verify that a method is using the appropriate numeric representation to interpret a particular value. 如下面的示例所示，你可以通过在将值转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式之前，通过确定值是否表示无符号或带符号类型，来确保方法正确地处理溢出。As the following example illustrates, you can ensure that the method handles overflows appropriately by first determining whether a value represents an unsigned or a signed type when converting it to its hexadecimal string representation. 如果原始值是无符号类型，但转换回带符号字节的转换将生成一个符号位为的值，则将引发异常。Throw an exception if the original value was an unsigned type but the conversion back to a signed byte yields a value whose sign bit is on. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#10)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#10)] ## Examples 下面的示例尝试将字符串数组中的元素解释为数字值的二进制、八进制和十六进制表示形式，以便将它们转换为无符号字节。The following example attempts to interpret the elements in a string array as the binary, octal, and hexadecimal representation of numeric values in order to convert them to unsigned bytes. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToSByte#16](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tosbyte/cs/tosbyte3.cs#16)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToSByte#16](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tosbyte/vb/tosbyte3.vb#16)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值是调用的基础类型 `value`的 方法的结果。The return value is the result of invoking the method of the underlying type of `value`. `provider` 使用户能够指定与 `value`内容有关的区域性特定的转换信息。`provider` enables the user to specify culture-specific conversion information about the contents of `value`. 例如，如果 `value` 是表示数字的 ，则 `provider` 可能会提供有关用于表示该数字的表示法的特定于区域性的信息。For example, if `value` is a that represents a number, `provider` could supply culture-specific information about the notation used to represent that number. 基类型忽略 `provider`;但是，如果 `value` 是实现 接口的用户定义类型，则可以使用参数。The base types ignore `provider`; however, the parameter may be used if `value` is a user-defined type that implements the interface. ## Examples 下面的示例定义一个实现 `Temperature` 接口的 类。The following example defines a `Temperature` class that implements the interface. 它的 方法的实现返回表示温度的私有 变量的内部值。Its implementation of the method returns the internal value of a private variable that represents the temperature. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果 `value` 为正且 `toBase` 为2、8或16，则返回的字符串使用符号和量的表示形式。If `value` is positive and `toBase` is 2, 8, or 16, the returned string uses sign-and-magnitude representation. 如果 `value` 为负数，并且 `toBase` 为2、8或16，则返回的字符串将使用两个补码表示形式。If `value` is negative and `toBase` is 2, 8, or 16, the returned string uses two's complement representation. 这意味着高序位字节（位15）的高序位被解释为符号位。This means that the high-order bit of the high-order byte (bit 15) is interpreted as the sign bit. 如果调用 方法来创建稍后将转换回数字的字符串，则应调用一个对应的方法来执行转换，该方法假设应调用类似的数值表示形式。If the method is called to create a string that will later be converted back to a number, a corresponding method that assumes a similar numeric representation should be called to perform the conversion. 此类方法包括 和 。Such methods include and . ## Examples 下面的示例将16位带符号整数数组中的每个元素转换为其等效的二进制、八进制、十进制和十六进制字符串表示形式。The following example converts each element in an array of 16-bit signed integers to its equivalent binary, octal, decimal, and hexadecimal string representations. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果 `value` 参数实现 接口，则方法将调用 `value`的 实现。If the `value` parameter implements the interface, the method calls the implementation of `value`. 否则，如果 `value` 参数实现 接口，则该方法将调用其 实现。Otherwise, if the `value` parameter implements the interface, the method calls its implementation. 如果 `value` 未实现任何接口，则方法将调用 `value` 参数的 `ToString()` 方法，并忽略 `provider` 参数。If `value` implements neither interface, the method calls the `value` parameter's `ToString()` method, and the `provider` parameter is ignored. 如果 `value` 参数实现 或 接口，则使用 `provider` 参数。The `provider` parameter is used if the `value` parameter implements the or interface. `provider` 参数最常见的用法是指定 `value`转换中使用的特定于区域性的信息。The most common use of the `provider` parameter is to specify culture-specific information used in the conversion of `value`. 例如，如果 `value` 参数为负数小数，则 `provider` 参数可以提供有关用于负号和小数点分隔符的表示法的区域性特定信息。For example, if the `value` parameter is a negative decimal number, the `provider` parameter can supply culture-specific information about the notation used for the negative sign and decimal separator. 下一节中的第二个示例说明了不提供区分区域性的格式设置信息的格式提供程序。The second example in the next section illustrates a format provider that does not supply culture-sensitive formatting information. ## Examples 下面的示例定义了一个 `Temperature` 类，该类重写 方法，但不实现 接口。The following example defines a `Temperature` class that overrides the method but does not implement the interface. 该示例演示如何调用 方法，进而调用 `Temperature.ToString` 方法。The example illustrates how calls to the method, in turn, call the `Temperature.ToString` method. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToString2#26](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tostring2/cs/tostring5.cs#26)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToString2#26](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tostring2/vb/tostring5.vb#26)] 下面的示例定义了一个 `Temperature` 类，该类实现 接口，但未实现 接口。The following example defines a `Temperature` class that implements the interface but does not implement the interface. 它的 实现以摄氏、华氏或开氏度表示 `Temperature` 值，具体取决于格式字符串。Its implementation represents the `Temperature` value in Celsius, Fahrenheit, or Kelvin, depending on the format string. 该示例还定义一个 `TemperatureProvider` 类，该类实现 并提供一个随机生成的格式字符串，该字符串由 `Temperature` 类的 实现使用。The example also defines a `TemperatureProvider` class that implements and provides a randomly generated format string that is used by the implementation of the `Temperature` class. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToString2#30](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tostring2/cs/tostring_obj30.cs#30)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToString2#30](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.tostring2/vb/tostring_obj30.vb#30)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此实现与 完全相同。This implementation is identical to . ## Examples 下面的示例定义了一个自定义 类，该类将其负号定义为字符串 "~"，并将其正负号定义为字符串 "！"。The following example defines a custom class that defines its negative sign as the string "~" and its positive sign as the string "!". 然后，它调用 方法将16位无符号整数值转换为其等效的字符串表示形式。It then calls the method to convert a 16-bit unsigned integer value to its equivalent string representation. 转换同时使用固定区域性和自定义的 对象。The conversion uses both the invariant culture and the custom object. 输出表明不使用此格式设置信息，因为默认情况下，"G" 格式说明符不包含正值的正号。The output indicates that this formatting information is not used, because by default the "G" format specifier does not include a positive sign with positive values. remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值是调用的基础类型 `value`的 方法的结果。The return value is the result of invoking the method of the underlying type of `value`. `provider` 使用户能够指定与 `value`内容有关的区域性特定的转换信息。`provider` enables the user to specify culture-specific conversion information about the contents of `value`. 例如，如果 `value` 是表示数字的 ，则 `provider` 可能会提供有关用于表示该数字的表示法的特定于区域性的信息。For example, if `value` is a that represents a number, `provider` could supply culture-specific information about the notation used to represent that number. 基类型忽略 `provider`;但是，如果 `value` 是实现 接口的用户定义类型，则可以使用参数。The base types ignore `provider`; however, the parameter may be used if `value` is a user-defined type that implements the interface. ## Examples 下面的示例定义了一个 `HexString` 类，该类实现 接口，并设计用于保存16位有符号和16位无符号值的字符串表示形式。The following example defines a `HexString` class that implements the interface and that is designed to hold the string representation of both 16-bit signed and 16-bit unsigned values. 类包含一个 `Sign` 属性，该属性指示其十六进制值的符号。The class includes a `Sign` property that indicates the sign of its hexadecimal value. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToUInt16#16](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint16/cs/touint16_3.cs#16)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToUInt16#16](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint16/vb/touint16_3.vb#16)] 下面的示例演示对作为参数传递 `HexString` 对象的 方法的调用，进而调用 `HexString` 类的 实现。The following example shows that a call to the method that passes a `HexString` object as a parameter, in turn, calls the implementation of the `HexString` class. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToUInt16#17](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint16/cs/touint16_3.cs#17)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToUInt16#17](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint16/vb/touint16_3.vb#17)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值是对 `value`调用 的结果。The return value is the result of invoking on `value`. `provider` 是获取 对象的 实例。`provider` is an instance that obtains a object. 对象提供有关 `value`格式的区域性特定信息。The object provides culture-specific information about the format of `value`. 如果 `null``provider`，则使用当前区域性的 。If `provider` is `null`, the for the current culture is used. 如果你不希望在转换失败时处理异常，则可以改为调用 方法。If you prefer not to handle an exception if the conversion fails, you can call the method instead. 它将返回一个 值，该值指示转换是成功还是失败。It returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed. ## Examples 下面的示例定义了一个自定义 对象，该对象将字符串 "pos" 识别为正号，将字符串 "neg" 识别为负号。The following example defines a custom object that recognizes the string "pos" as the positive sign and the string "neg" as the negative sign. 然后，它会使用此提供程序和固定区域性的 提供程序尝试将数值字符串数组的每个元素转换为整数。It then attempts to convert each element of a numeric string array to an integer using both this provider and the provider for the invariant culture. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果 `fromBase` 为16，则可以使用 "0x" 或 "0X" 作为 `value` 参数指定的数字的前缀。If `fromBase` is 16, you can prefix the number specified by the `value` parameter with "0x" or "0X". 由于 的数据类型仅支持未签名的值，因此 方法假定 `value` 是使用无符号二进制表示形式表示的。Because the data type supports unsigned values only, the method assumes that `value` is expressed using unsigned binary representation. 换句话说，所有的16位均用于表示数值，并且不存在符号位。In other words, all 16 bits are used to represent the numeric value, and a sign bit is absent. 因此，可以编写代码，在此代码中，如果有符号整数值超出 数据类型的范围，则会将其转换为 值，而不会引发异常。As a result, it is possible to write code in which a signed integer value that is out of the range of the data type is converted to a value without the method throwing an exception. 下面的示例将 转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式，然后调用 方法。The following example converts to its hexadecimal string representation, and then calls the method. 方法会显示消息 "0x8000 转换为 32768"，而不是引发异常。Instead of throwing an exception, the method displays the message, "0x8000 converts to 32768." [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#11)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#11)] 执行二元运算或数值转换时，开发人员始终负责验证方法或运算符是否使用适当的数值表示形式来解释特定值。When performing binary operations or numeric conversions, it is always the responsibility of the developer to verify that a method or operator is using the appropriate numeric representation to interpret a particular value. 下面的示例演示了一种方法，用于确保在将十六进制字符串转换为 值时，方法不会将二进制表示形式不正确地用于解释使用两个补数表示形式的值。The following example illustrates one technique for ensuring that the method does not inappropriately use binary representation to interpret a value that uses two's complement representation when converting a hexadecimal string to a value. 该示例在将值转换为其字符串表示形式时，确定某个值是否表示有符号或无符号整数。The example determines whether a value represents a signed or an unsigned integer while it is converting that value to its string representation. 当示例将值转换为 值时，它会检查原始值是否为有符号整数。When the example converts the value to a value, it checks whether the original value was a signed integer. 如果是这样，且设置了其高序位（表示原始值为负），该方法将引发异常。If so, and if its high-order bit is set (which indicates that the original value was negative), the method throws an exception. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#12)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#12)] ## Examples 下面的示例尝试将数值字符串数组中的每个元素解释为十六进制值，并将其转换为16位无符号整数。The following example attempts to interpret each element in an array of numeric strings as a hexadecimal value and to convert it to an unsigned 16-bit integer. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToUInt16#15](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint16/cs/touint16_2.cs#15)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToUInt16#15](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint16/vb/touint16_2.vb#15)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值是调用的基础类型 `value`的 方法的结果。The return value is the result of invoking the method of the underlying type of `value`. `provider` 使用户能够指定与 `value`内容有关的区域性特定的转换信息。`provider` enables the user to specify culture-specific conversion information about the contents of `value`. 例如，如果 `value` 是表示数字的 ，则 `provider` 可能会提供有关用于表示该数字的表示法的特定于区域性的信息。For example, if `value` is a that represents a number, `provider` could supply culture-specific information about the notation used to represent that number. 基类型忽略 `provider`;但是，如果 `value` 是实现 接口的用户定义类型，则可以使用参数。The base types ignore `provider`; however, the parameter may be used if `value` is a user-defined type that implements the interface. ## Examples 下面的示例定义了一个 `HexString` 类，该类实现 接口，并设计用于保存32位有符号值和32位无符号值的字符串表示形式。The following example defines a `HexString` class that implements the interface and that is designed to hold the string representation of both 32-bit signed and 32-bit unsigned values. 类包含一个 `Sign` 属性，该属性指示其十六进制值的符号。The class includes a `Sign` property that indicates the sign of its hexadecimal value.
