remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果 `fromBase` 为16，则可以使用 "0x" 或 "0X" 作为 `value` 参数指定的数字的前缀。If `fromBase` is 16, you can prefix the number specified by the `value` parameter with "0x" or "0X". 由于 的数据类型仅支持未签名的值，因此 方法假定 `value` 是使用无符号二进制表示形式表示的。Because the data type supports unsigned values only, the method assumes that `value` is expressed using unsigned binary representation. 换句话说，所有32位均用于表示数值，并且不存在符号位。In other words, all 32 bits are used to represent the numeric value, and a sign bit is absent. 因此，可以编写代码，在此代码中，如果有符号整数值超出 数据类型的范围，则会将其转换为 值，而不会引发异常。As a result, it is possible to write code in which a signed integer value that is out of the range of the data type is converted to a value without the method throwing an exception. 下面的示例将 转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式，然后调用 方法。The following example converts to its hexadecimal string representation, and then calls the method. 方法会显示消息 "0x80000000 转换为 2147483648"，而不是引发异常。Instead of throwing an exception, the method displays the message, "0x80000000 converts to 2147483648." [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#13](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#13)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#13](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#13)] 执行二元运算或数值转换时，开发人员始终负责验证方法或运算符是否使用适当的数值表示形式来解释特定值。When performing binary operations or numeric conversions, it is always the responsibility of the developer to verify that a method or operator is using the appropriate numeric representation to interpret a particular value. 下面的示例演示了一种方法，用于确保在将十六进制字符串转换为 值时，方法不会将二进制表示形式不正确地用于解释使用两个补数表示形式的值。The following example illustrates one technique for ensuring that the method does not inappropriately use binary representation to interpret a value that uses two's complement representation when converting a hexadecimal string to a value. 该示例在将值转换为其字符串表示形式时，确定某个值是否表示有符号或无符号整数。The example determines whether a value represents a signed or an unsigned integer while it is converting that value to its string representation. 当示例将值转换为 值时，它会检查原始值是否为有符号整数。When the example converts the value to a value, it checks whether the original value was a signed integer. 如果是这样，且设置了其高序位（表示原始值为负），该方法将引发异常。If so, and if its high-order bit is set (which indicates that the original value was negative), the method throws an exception. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#14](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#14)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#14](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#14)] ## Examples 下面的示例尝试将数值字符串数组中的每个元素解释为十六进制值并将其转换为无符号整数。The following example attempts to interpret each element in an array of numeric strings as a hexadecimal value and to convert it to an unsigned integer. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToUInt32#16](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint32/cs/touint32_3.cs#16)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToUInt32#16](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint32/vb/touint32_3.vb#16)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值是调用的基础类型 `value`的 方法的结果。The return value is the result of invoking the method of the underlying type of `value`. `provider` 使用户能够指定与 `value`内容有关的区域性特定的转换信息。`provider` enables the user to specify culture-specific conversion information about the contents of `value`. 例如，如果 `value` 是表示数字的 ，则 `provider` 可能会提供有关用于表示该数字的表示法的特定于区域性的信息。For example, if `value` is a that represents a number, `provider` could supply culture-specific information about the notation used to represent that number. 基类型忽略 `provider`;但是，如果 `value` 是实现 接口的用户定义类型，则可以使用参数。The base types ignore `provider`; however, the parameter may be used if `value` is a user-defined type that implements the interface. ## Examples 下面的示例定义了一个 `HexString` 类，该类实现 接口，并设计用于保存64位有符号值和64位无符号值的字符串表示形式。The following example defines a `HexString` class that implements the interface and that is designed to hold the string representation of both 64-bit signed and 64-bit unsigned values. 类包含一个 `Sign` 属性，该属性指示其十六进制值的符号。The class includes a `Sign` property that indicates the sign of its hexadecimal value. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToUInt64#17](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint64/cs/touint64_4.cs#17)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToUInt64#17](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint64/vb/touint64_4.vb#17)] 下面的示例演示对作为参数传递 `HexString` 对象的 方法的调用，进而调用 `HexString` 类的 实现。The following example shows that a call to the method that passes a `HexString` object as a parameter, in turn, calls the implementation of the `HexString` class. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToUInt64#18](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint64/cs/touint64_4.cs#18)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToUInt64#18](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint64/vb/touint64_4.vb#18)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值是对 `value`调用 的结果。The return value is the result of invoking on `value`. `provider` 是获取 对象的 实现。`provider` is an implementation that obtains a object. 对象提供有关 `value`格式的区域性特定信息。The object provides culture-specific information about the format of `value`. 如果 `null``provider`，则使用当前区域性的 对象。If `provider` is `null`, the object for the current culture is used. 如果你不希望在转换失败时处理异常，则可以改为调用 方法。If you prefer not to handle an exception if the conversion fails, you can call the method instead. 它将返回一个 值，该值指示转换是成功还是失败。It returns a value that indicates whether the conversion succeeded or failed. ## Examples 下面的示例定义了一个自定义 对象，该对象将字符串 "pos" 识别为正号，将字符串 "neg" 识别为负号。The following example defines a custom object that recognizes the string "pos" as the positive sign and the string "neg" as the negative sign. 然后，它会尝试将数值字符串数组的每个元素转换为无符号长整数。It then attempts to convert each element of a numeric string array to an unsigned long integer. 转换同时为固定区域性使用自定义提供程序和 提供程序。The conversion uses both the custom provider and the provider for the invariant culture. param.span: A string that contains the number to convert.

span.span: A string that contains the number to convert.

param.name: fromBase
param.span: The base of the number in , which must be 2, 8, 10, or 16.

summary.span: Converts the string representation of a number in a specified base to an equivalent 64-bit unsigned integer.

returns.span: A 64-bit unsigned integer that is equivalent to the number in , or 0 (zero) if is .

span.span: A 64-bit unsigned integer that is equivalent to the number in , or 0 (zero) if is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果 `fromBase` 为16，则可以使用 "0x" 或 "0X" 作为 `value` 参数指定的数字的前缀。If `fromBase` is 16, you can prefix the number specified by the `value` parameter with "0x" or "0X". 由于 的数据类型仅支持未签名的值，因此 方法假定 `value` 是使用无符号二进制表示形式表示的。Because the data type supports unsigned values only, the method assumes that `value` is expressed using unsigned binary representation. 换句话说，所有64位均用于表示数值，并且不存在符号位。In other words, all 64 bits are used to represent the numeric value, and a sign bit is absent. 因此，可以编写代码，在此代码中，在不引发异常的情况下，将不在 数据类型范围内的带符号长整数值转换为 值。As a result, it is possible to write code in which a signed long integer value that is out of the range of the data type is converted to a value without the method throwing an exception. 下面的示例将 转换为其十六进制字符串表示形式，然后调用 方法。The following example converts to its hexadecimal string representation, and then calls the method. 方法不会引发异常，而是显示消息 "0x8000000000000000 转换为 9223372036854775808"。Instead of throwing an exception, the method displays the message, "0x8000000000000000 converts to 9223372036854775808." [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#15](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#15)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#15](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#15)] 执行二元运算或数值转换时，开发人员始终负责验证方法或运算符是否使用适当的数值表示形式来解释特定值。When performing binary operations or numeric conversions, it is always the responsibility of the developer to verify that a method or operator is using the appropriate numeric representation to interpret a particular value. 下面的示例演示了一种方法，用于确保在将十六进制字符串转换为 值时，方法不会将二进制表示形式不正确地用于解释使用两个补数表示形式的值。The following example illustrates one technique for ensuring that the method does not inappropriately use binary representation to interpret a value that uses two's complement representation when converting a hexadecimal string to a value. 该示例在将值转换为其字符串表示形式时，确定某个值是否表示有符号或无符号整数。The example determines whether a value represents a signed or an unsigned integer while it is converting that value to its string representation. 当示例将值转换为 值时，它会检查原始值是否为有符号整数。When the example converts the value to a value, it checks whether the original value was a signed integer. 如果是这样，且设置了其高序位（表示原始值为负），该方法将引发异常。If so, and if its high-order bit is set (which indicates that the original value was negative), the method throws an exception. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.BaseConversion#16](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/cs/Conversion.cs#16)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.BaseConversion#16](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Convert.BaseConversion/vb/Conversion.vb#16)] ## Examples 下面的示例尝试将数值字符串数组中的每个元素解释为十六进制值，并将其转换为无符号长整数。The following example attempts to interpret each element in an array of numeric strings as a hexadecimal value and to convert it to an unsigned long integer. [!code-csharp[System.Convert.ToUInt64#16](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint64/cs/touint64_3.cs#16)] [!code-vb[System.Convert.ToUInt64#16](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.convert.touint64/vb/touint64_3.vb#16)]
